DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , multi-center , non-randomized study Wildcat Catheter cross single femoropopliteal chronic total occlusion ( CTO ) . Safety efficacy evaluate index procedure 30-day follow-up .
DOC.brief_title: Chronic Total Occlusion Crossing With Wildcat Catheter
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient willing able provide inform consent . 2 . Patient willing able comply study protocol . 3 . Patient > 18 year old . 4 . Patient peripheral arterial disease require revascularization evidence contrast , CT MR angiography . 5 . Patient occlude femoropopliteal artery 99100 % stenosed ≥ 1 cm ≤ 30 cm length visual estimate . 6 . Target femoropopliteal vessel ≥ 3.0 mm diameter . 7 . Patient Rutherford Classification 25 . 1 . Patient known sensitivity allergy contrast material adequately pretreated . 2 . Patient known sensitivity allergy antiplatelet medication . 3 . Patient pregnant lactating . 4 . Patient coexist disease medical condition contraindicate percutaneous intervention . 5 . Target vessel severely calcify evidenced angiography . 6 . Target lesion bypass graft . 7 . Target lesion stent ( i.e. , instent restenosis ) . 8 . Patient procedure target limb within 7 day . 9 . Patient procedure target limb within past 30 day unstable . 10 . Patient simultaneously participate investigational device drug study . 11 . Patient plan surgical interventional procedure within 30 day study procedure .
